message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC, cs.DB, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with similarity search in social and knowledge networks, which involves analyzing the topology of the network. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Social and Information Networks (cs.SOC), Databases (cs.DB), or Machine Learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper proposes a new similarity metric, which involves computing similarity from the perspective of both the query node and the candidate nodes, indicating that it could also belong to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SOC) or Information Retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on four large real-world networks, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SOC) or Databases (cs.DB). Overall, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC, cs.DB, and cs.LG, in that order.
